summary: For 2019, the USDA's Market Facilitation Program paid $14.4 billion to about 644,000 farming operations USDA said were hurt by trade disruptions and tariffs. USDA changed the payment structure for the three types of commodities covered by this program for 2019. For example, it set county-specific payment rates for nonspecialty crops such as corn and soybeans. It also doubled the maximum payment to $250,000 for...
title: USDA Market Facilitation Program: Information on Payments for 2019
